Ambush (Tactic 8).name: Ambush (Tactic 8)
Ambush (Tactic 8).description:
Skirmisher

Your skirmishers are experts at ambushing. On the first round of a war encounter, if your turn occurs before any enemy army turns, you can choose to start the encounter with your army already engaged with an enemy army whose initiative result is lower than yours. If you do so, your army gains a +2 status bonus on the first Attack war action they make against that army on the first round of the encounter.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-effects.Item.hagZq8f6ZasEsAiH]{Ambush}

Amphibious (Unique Tactic).name: Amphibious (Unique Tactic)
Amphibious (Unique Tactic).description: Frog Riders ignore difficult terrain caused by swamps or water and gain a +2 circumstance bonus on Maneuver checks while fighting on a battlefield that features either of these terrains.

Battlefield Adaptability (Unique Tactic).name: Battlefield Adaptability (Unique Tactic)
Battlefield Adaptability (Unique Tactic).description:
The First World army has a wide range of creatures in its ranks, and it can shift its tactics to support those with different mobilities. It can take this action to achieve one of the following benefits: ignore ground-based difficult terrain, reduce @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.HbNAT8XxZD1OWMwE]{Mired} to 0, become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.Pvkj6MUcASchcy6x]{Concealed}, or gain a +2 circumstance bonus on Maneuver checks to Advance and to Disengage. The effect lasts until the start of the First World Army’s next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-effects.Item.1EaUITRS5jMcFlRG]{Battlefield Adaptability}

Bloodied But Unbroken (Tactic 5).name: Bloodied But Unbroken (Tactic 5)
Bloodied But Unbroken (Tactic 5).description:
Cavalry Infantry Skirmisher

The army is at its greatest during the most desperate times. When the army’s hit points are at or below its Rout Threshold, it gains a +1 status bonus to its AC, Mobility, Morale, and attack rolls. At 10th level or higher, this bonus increases to +2.

Brave (Unique Tactic).name: Brave (Unique Tactic)
Brave (Unique Tactic).description: Nomen scouts are extraordinarily fearless and do not possess a Rout Threshold, and gain a +2 circumstance bonus on Morale checks made to avoid rout from other sources.

Brutal Assault (Unique Tactic).name: Brutal Assault (Unique Tactic)
Brutal Assault (Unique Tactic).description: The Troll Marauders can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.ZJmURLLXPieDMMtj]{All-Out Assault} action. When they do, an army damaged by the assault must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:24]{Morale} check to avoid becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.LRcdpNTi2OE0LmHD]{Shaken 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.LRcdpNTi2OE0LmHD]{Shaken 2} on a critical failure) as a result of the brutality of this attack.

Burning Weaponry (Unique Tactic).name: Burning Weaponry (Unique Tactic)
Burning Weaponry (Unique Tactic).description: Unlike basic siege engine armies, Greengripe Bombardiers can make melee Strikes while engaged. When a Greengripe Bombardier scores a critical success on a Strike while taking the Battle action against an army (but not against a fortification), the army struck must make a successful Maneuver check against the Greengripe Bombardiers’ Maneuver DC or take one additional point of damage from the goblins’ burning weaponry.

Cavalry Experts (Tactic 6).name: Cavalry Experts (Tactic 6)
Cavalry Experts (Tactic 6).description:
Cavalry

The army’s expert training with mounts increases its status bonus from its Overrun ability to +2. At 12th level, the army ignores the status penalty to Maneuver and Morale saves from its Overrun ability.

Chorus of Croaks (Unique Tactic).name: Chorus of Croaks (Unique Tactic)
Chorus of Croaks (Unique Tactic).description:
The terrifying croaking that constantly issues from this army of boggards causes all engaged enemy armies to suffer a –2 status penalty on Morale checks. The M’botuu Frog Riders can use the Taunt tactical action. If they know the Focused Devotion tactic, they treat critical failures made when attempting to Taunt as failures instead.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-effects.Item.ZUjrtgVS1OpiheF6]{Chorus of Croaks}

Darkvision (Tactic 1).name: Darkvision (Tactic 1)
Darkvision (Tactic 1).description:
Cavalry Infantry Siege Skirmisher

The army includes several spotters and scouts who have darkvision, and the rest of the soldiers have been trained to follow their lead so that the army itself functions as if it had darkvision.

Accustomed to Panic (Unique Tactic).name: Accustomed to Panic (Unique Tactic)
Accustomed to Panic (Unique Tactic).description: Trigger The Sootscale Warriors’ shaken condition increases while they are not routed. Effect The Sootscales take comfort in their fear and channel the panic into energy. Rather than increase their shaken condition, they reduce their weary condition value by 1. Additionally, when the Sootscales use the Disengage action, the result is improved one degree.

Defensive Tactics (Tactic 3).name: Defensive Tactics (Tactic 3)
Defensive Tactics (Tactic 3).description:
Cavalry Infantry Siege Skirmisher

The army is especially good at enacting defensive tactics. The army gains a +1 status bonus on Maneuver checks made to Guard. This bonus increases to +2 at 9th level, and +3 at 17th level. The army can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.GMzJCKSvd8mQCfDH]{Defensive Stance} tactical war action.

Explosive Defeat (Unique Tactic).name: Explosive Defeat (Unique Tactic)
Explosive Defeat (Unique Tactic).description: When the Greengripe Bombardiers are defeated, their alchemical siege engine explodes. Any army engaged with the Greengripe Bombardiers must succeed at a Maneuver check against the Greengripe Bombardier’s Maneuver DC or take [[/r 1]] point of damage ([[/r 2]] points of damage on a critical failure). As long as the Greengripe Bombardiers aren’t  destroyed, their siege engine gear is rebuilt automatically once the army loses the defeated condition.

Explosive Shot (Tactic 11).name: Explosive Shot (Tactic 11)
Explosive Shot (Tactic 11).description:
Siege

The army’s ranged attacks explode and spray fire, shrapnel, or other damaging material in every direction. Whenever the army critically hits a non-distant army with a ranged Strike, inflict [[/r 1]] point of additional damage to another non-distant enemy army of your choice. You can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.l35ZL1ahioM5aJuV]{Overwhelming Bombardment} tactical war action with the army.

Field Triage (Tactic 6).name: Field Triage (Tactic 6)
Field Triage (Tactic 6).description:
Infantry Skirmisher

The army’s soldiers are adept at using emergency methods to treat wounds. The army gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.97fBYPyNW7jDUlBs]{Battlefield Medicine} tactical war action.

Flaming Shot (Tactic 9).name: Flaming Shot (Tactic 9)
Flaming Shot (Tactic 9).description:
Cavalry Infantry Siege Skirmisher

The army attacks with projectiles treated with alchemical or magical oils that ignite as they are fired. When your army succeeds at a ranged Strike, the target army must attempt a @Check[type:reflex]{Maneuver} check against your army’s attack DC; if it fails, the Strike inflicts [[/r 1]] additional point of damage.

Flexible Tactics (Tactic 5).name: Flexible Tactics (Tactic 5)
Flexible Tactics (Tactic 5).description:
Infantry Skirmisher

The army uses unconventional tactics. You can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.mqKzBYY3LuRpczw4]{Dirty Fighting}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.jQ9YCg5ZLYb3UGml]{False Retreat}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.vRF02npDZ24C1xng]{Feint} tactical war actions, and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.KOiTOYwnhEwHtUXa]{Counterattack} tactical reaction with the army.

Flight (Unique Tactic).name: Flight (Unique Tactic)
Flight (Unique Tactic).description: The Wyvern Flight ignores all ground- based difficult terrain and cannot become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.HbNAT8XxZD1OWMwE]{Mired} by effects that can be escaped by flight. When they use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.21aSK6Dh0FpcdWbb]{Disengage} action against armies that can’t fly, their check result is improved one degree. Armies that lack the ability to fly suffer a –2 circumstance penalty on @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.59vwuUVFAEs0yfKt]{Advance} actions against a Wyvern Flight.

Focused Devotion (Tactic 3).name: Focused Devotion (Tactic 3)
Focused Devotion (Tactic 3).description:
Cavalry Infantry Siege Skirmisher

The army is particularly loyal to your cause. The army gains a +1 status bonus on Morale checks made to Rally. This bonus increases to +2 at 9th level, and +3 at 17th level. The army can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.ICVHilTUEvuUfeYZ]{Taunt} tactical war action.

Frightening Foe (Unique Tactic).name: Frightening Foe (Unique Tactic)
Frightening Foe (Unique Tactic).description: The Troll Marauders can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.ICVHilTUEvuUfeYZ]{Taunt} tactical action. When they do, they gain a +2 status bonus on their Morale check if they used the Regeneration tactic this turn.

Furious Charge (Unique Tactic).name: Furious Charge (Unique Tactic)
Furious Charge (Unique Tactic).description: Frequency once per war encounter; Effect The Tiger Lord Berserkers charge at an enemy army, taking an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.59vwuUVFAEs0yfKt]{Advance} action to attempt to engage. If the Tiger Lords manage to engage successfully, they can attempt a melee Strike against the army as a reaction.

Hold The Line (Tactic 1).name: Hold The Line (Tactic 1)
Hold The Line (Tactic 1).description:
Cavalry Infantry Siege Skirmisher

The army has trained to maintain position even in the face of overwhelming opponents. The army gains a +1 status bonus on Morale checks made to resist rout, and its Rout Threshold is equal to 1/4 it’s total Hit Points (rounded up).

Hurl Nets (Unique Tactic).name: Hurl Nets (Unique Tactic)
Hurl Nets (Unique Tactic).description: If the Tok-Nikrat Scouts hit an army with a net Strike, the army takes no damage. Instead, it increases its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.HbNAT8XxZD1OWMwE]{Mired} condition value by 1 (or by 2 on a critical success). An army that is mired as a result of hurled nets can attempt to reduce the value of this mired condition (but not that caused by other sources) by attempting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.qNxyZfS4Ald098Gy]{Battle} action against the Tok-Nikrat Scout’s Maneuver DC. On a success, the army reduces their mired condition by 1 (or by 2 on a critical success), but on a critical failure, they increase the mired condition caused by the hurled nets by 1. Tok-Nikrat Scouts can’t hurl nets at a target army that is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.g899cTZQJdXwN6Zu]{Distant}.

Increased Ammunition (Tactic 5).name: Increased Ammunition (Tactic 5)
Increased Ammunition (Tactic 5).description: You increase the number of times your army can use ranged Strikes in each war encounter by 2. This tactic can be taken multiple times; each time you do so, increase the army’s maximum number of ranged Strikes by 2.

Keen Eyed (Tactic 5).name: Keen Eyed (Tactic 5)
Keen Eyed (Tactic 5).description:
Cavalry Infantry Siege Skirmisher

The army includes several spotters and scouts who are particularly keen-eyed. The army gains a +2 status bonus on initiative checks.

Keep Up The Pressure (Tactic 3).name: Keep Up The Pressure (Tactic 3)
Keep Up The Pressure (Tactic 3).description:
Cavalry Infantry Siege Skirmisher

The commander’s swift, decisive directions help the army attack more accurately. If an army attacks the same target a second time in a round, its multiple attack penalty is –4 rather than –5, and if they attack that same army a third time in a round, its multiple attack penalty is –8 rather than –10.

Live Off The Land (Tactic 1).name: Live Off The Land (Tactic 1)
Live Off The Land (Tactic 1).description:
Cavalry Infantry Skirmisher

The army is trained to be self-sufficient and sustains itself via hunting and gathering when they’re in the wild. If during a Kingdom turn’s Upkeep phase this army is located in a hex that doesn’t include a settlement, and if the army is not garrisoned, it reduces its Consumption by 1.

Low-Light Vision (Tactic 1).name: Low-Light Vision (Tactic 1)
Low-Light Vision (Tactic 1).description: The army includes several spotters and scouts who have low-light vision, and the rest of the soldiers have been trained to follow their lead so that the army itself functions as if it had low-light vision.

Merciless (Tactic 5).name: Merciless (Tactic 5)
Merciless (Tactic 5).description:
Cavalry Infantry

This army is difficult to escape from. The army’s Maneuver DC gains a +2 status bonus when other armies attempt Mobility checks against it while attempting to Disengage. This army can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.ZJmURLLXPieDMMtj]{All-Out Assault} tactical war action.

Opening Salvo (Tactic 8).name: Opening Salvo (Tactic 8)
Opening Salvo (Tactic 8).description:
Cavalry Siege Skirmisher

Your army has trained to take the first shot at distant foes. On the first round of a war encounter, if your turn occurs before any enemy army turns, you can choose to start the encounter with your army @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.g899cTZQJdXwN6Zu]{Distant} from all enemy armies.

Overrun.name: Overrun
Overrun.description: Cavalry armies gain a +1 status bonus on weapon attacks against infantry and skirmisher armies, but they suffer a –1 status penalty on Maneuver and Morale saves against area attacks and mental attacks.

Pitaxian Training (Unique Tactic).name: Pitaxian Training (Unique Tactic)
Pitaxian Training (Unique Tactic).description: The Pitaxian Raiders can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.KOiTOYwnhEwHtUXa]{Counterattack}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.mqKzBYY3LuRpczw4]{Dirty Fighting}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.vRF02npDZ24C1xng]{Feint} tactical actions.

Primal Magic (Unique Tactic).name: Primal Magic (Unique Tactic)
Primal Magic (Unique Tactic).description:
Requirement The First World army is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.1p98vHZNFYttifsn]{Engaged}; Effect The First World army uses its primal magic against another army on the battlefield and must attempt a @Check[type:will|traits:action:primal-magic]{Morale} check against the target’s Morale DC. If they succeed, the First World army applies one of the following effects, determined randomly ([[/r 1d10]]), to the target army.

  • 1–2 Entangling Vines Coils of whipping vines grow out of the ground to entangle the army. The army increases its@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.HbNAT8XxZD1OWMwE]{Mired} condition by 1 (2 on a critical hit).
  • 3–4 Horrific Visions The soldiers’ minds are assaulted with horrific illusions. The army increases its@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.LRcdpNTi2OE0LmHD]{Shaken} condition by 1 (2 on a critical hit).
  • 5–6 Primal Storm A churning storm cloud above the army strikes the soldiers dozens of times with bolts of lightning, inflicting [[/r 1]] point of damage to the army ([[/r 2]] points of damage on a critical hit). Until the end of the targeted army’s next turn, it functions as if in @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-battlefield-terrain-features.Item.KvyQs1f1TYA4Ozqo]{Strong Wind} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-battlefield-terrain-features.Item.quvtwaUHKm9r4bNQ]{Rain} (see Battlefield Terrain Features on page 578).
  • 7–8 Sensory Assault The soldiers become overwhelmed with strange lights or tricked by illusions. Until the end of their next turn, the army takes a –2 circumstance penalty on all attacks and Maneuver checks. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-effects.Item.dW4dFXiW1MwPaEN1]{Primal Magic - Sensory Assault}
  • 9–10 Overwhelming Magic Roll twice and apply both results, but the First World army suffers a –4 circumstance penalty on its Morale check against the target army’s Morale DC.

Reckless Flankers (Tactic 5).name: Reckless Flankers (Tactic 5)
Reckless Flankers (Tactic 5).description:
Cavalry Skirmisher

Your army is skilled at surrounding their foes and distracting them, at the cost of spreading out too much and being more vulnerable. When you use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.59vwuUVFAEs0yfKt]{Advance} war action to successfully engage an army, you can choose to take a –2 circumstance penalty to your AC in order to gain a +1 circumstance bonus on attack rolls. If you do so, these modifiers remain in effect until you are no longer engaged. You can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.ScL9DLdeBqvvEY0m]{Outflank} tactical war action.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-effects.Item.JnLlD5MQCdXf4NgA]{Reckless Flankers}

Regeneration (Unique Tactic).name: Regeneration (Unique Tactic)
Regeneration (Unique Tactic).description: At the beginning of its turn, the Troll Marauders regain [[/r 1]] Hit Point. The Troll Marauders cannot be destroyed as usual unless they lose this tactic. The PCs can cause the trolls to lose the Regeneration tactic via prepared firepots (see page 296); while the trolls’ Regeneration tactic is lost, their RT increases to 3. Otherwise, an army that engages the Troll Marauders while they are defeated can take a three-round action to burn the trolls and destroy their army.

Revel in Battle (Unique Tactic).name: Revel in Battle (Unique Tactic)
Revel in Battle (Unique Tactic).description: Trigger The Tiger Lord Berserkers score a critical hit with a melee Strike. Effect The barbarians are infused with vigor and furious passion at their devastating blow. The army restores [[/r 1]] hit point.

Self-Sufficient (Unique Tactic).name: Self-Sufficient (Unique Tactic)
Self-Sufficient (Unique Tactic).description: Nomen scouts are adept at providing for themselves, and never count against the kingdom’s consumption. Furthermore, they can provide for other armies, and as long as they are not defeated during a Kingdom turn’s Upkeep phase, they reduce the kingdom’s consumption value by 1.

Sharpshooter (Tactic 5).name: Sharpshooter (Tactic 5)
Sharpshooter (Tactic 5).description:
Cavalry Infantry Skirmisher

The commander drills the army in precision ranged attacks. You gain a +1 status bonus on attacks with ranged Strikes, but suffer a –2 status bonus on attacks with melee Strikes. At 9th level, the penalty to melee Strikes is reduced to –1, and at 15th level the penalty to melee Strikes is removed. The army can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.xwc8G2tA6ryhhOpK]{Covering Fire} tactical war action.

Swamp Charge (Unique Tactic).name: Swamp Charge (Unique Tactic)
Swamp Charge (Unique Tactic).description: If the battlefield includes swamp or water, the M’botuu Frog Riders can start the encounter engaged with a target enemy army. If they do so, they gain a +1 circumstance bonus on melee Strikes against that army on the first turn of the encounter.

Swamp Dwellers (Unique Tactic).name: Swamp Dwellers (Unique Tactic)
Swamp Dwellers (Unique Tactic).description: The lizardfolk defenders have the Live off the Land tactic for free (it does not count against the maximum number of tactics the army can possess), do not treat water or swamp on a battlefield as difficult terrain, and gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Scouting checks attempted in hexes that include swamps or water.

Swift Recovery (Unique Tactic).name: Swift Recovery (Unique Tactic)
Swift Recovery (Unique Tactic).description: Frequency once per battle; Effect The army calls upon its magical connection to the First World to recover. This either restores [[/r ]] hit points or reduces the army’s @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.eIQC69sOPbHAGxHC]{Weary} condition value by 2.

Tactical Training (Unique Tactic).name: Tactical Training (Unique Tactic)
Tactical Training (Unique Tactic).description: The First World Army can use the following tactical actions:  @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.KOiTOYwnhEwHtUXa]{Counterattack}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.mqKzBYY3LuRpczw4]{Dirty Fighting}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.vRF02npDZ24C1xng]{Feint}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.ICVHilTUEvuUfeYZ]{Taunt}.

Toughened Soldiers (Tactic 1).name: Toughened Soldiers (Tactic 1)
Toughened Soldiers (Tactic 1).description:
Cavalry Infantry Siege Skirmisher

The army is particularly hardy. Increase its maximum Hit Points by 1. You can take this tactic multiple times; each time you do, increase the army’s maximum Hit Points by 1.

Trampeling Charge (Unique Tactic).name: Trampeling Charge (Unique Tactic)
Trampeling Charge (Unique Tactic).description:
The Riders trample an enemy army. They attempt a @Check[type:reflex|traits:action:trampling-charge]{Maneuver} check against a target non-engaged army’s Maneuver DC. Trampling Charge does not trigger @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.KOiTOYwnhEwHtUXa]{Counterattack} reactions. 

Critical Success The target army takes [[/r 2]] points of damage and increases their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.LRcdpNTi2OE0LmHD]{Shaken} value by 1.

Success The target army takes [[/r 1]] point of damage. 

Failure The target army takes [[/r 1]] point of damage. The Tusker Riders are now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.1p98vHZNFYttifsn]{Engaged} with the target army.

Critical Failure The Tusker Riders are now @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.1p98vHZNFYttifsn]{Engaged} with the target army and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.3Zcj5sBiZXKzd8hu]{Outflanked} until the start of their next turn.

Trample (Unique Tactic).name: Trample (Unique Tactic)
Trample (Unique Tactic).description: Nomen Scouts can attempt to trample an engaged enemy army by attempting a [[/r 1d20+20]] melee Strike against the army’s AC. On a hit, they inflict [[/r 1]] point of damage ([[/r 2]] points on a critical hit) and automatically move away from the army—they are no longer engaged with that army.

Warmongers (Unique Tactic).name: Warmongers (Unique Tactic)
Warmongers (Unique Tactic).description: The Tiger Lord Berserkers can use the following Tactical Actions without needing to meet additional requirements: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.ZJmURLLXPieDMMtj]{All-Out Assault}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.KOiTOYwnhEwHtUXa]{Counterattack}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.ICVHilTUEvuUfeYZ]{Taunt}

Water Retreat (Unique Tactic).name: Water Retreat (Unique Tactic)
Water Retreat (Unique Tactic).description: If the battlefield features water terrain, Tok-Nikrat Scouts gain a +4 circumstance bonus on Maneuver checks made to Disengage.

Water Stride (Unique Tactic).name: Water Stride (Unique Tactic)
Water Stride (Unique Tactic).description: The Tok-Nikrat Scouts stride over watery surfaces, and they ignore difficult terrain caused by water or swamps. They gain a +4 circumstance bonus on initiative checks in war encounters when the battlefield  features either terrain.

Wyvern Tactics (Unique Tactic).name: Wyvern Tactics (Unique Tactic)
Wyvern Tactics (Unique Tactic).description: The Wyvern Flight can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.ZJmURLLXPieDMMtj]{All-Out Assault} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.KOiTOYwnhEwHtUXa]{Counterattack} tactical actions.

Wyvern Venom (Unique Tactic).name: Wyvern Venom (Unique Tactic)
Wyvern Venom (Unique Tactic).description: An army that takes damage from a Wyvern Flight’s melee strike increases its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.eIQC69sOPbHAGxHC]{Weary} condition value by 1. If this would cause an army to increase its weary condition above 4, it instead takes [[/r 1]] point of damage. Each time an army regains Hit Points during a battle, it can attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:11] check; on a success, it no longer suffers the ongoing effects of Wyvern Venom (but can still be affected by it later from a future attack, and does not reset its weary condition). The effects of Wyvern Venom also end as soon as an army escapes the battlefield or once the battle ends.

Engines of War.name: Engines of War
Engines of War.description: Siege engines cannot be outfitted with gear. They cannot attack engaged armies. They are more difficult to destroy due to their higher hit points  than other basic armies. A siege engine can attack and damage fortifications with its ranged attacks as part of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.qNxyZfS4Ald098Gy]{Battle} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.l35ZL1ahioM5aJuV]{Overwhelming Bombardment} actions.

Reactive Rally (Unique Tactic).name: Reactive Rally (Unique Tactic)
Reactive Rally (Unique Tactic).description: Requirement The Tiger Lords are routed; Effect Instead of taking a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.D680ctCFIpsmz82i]{Retreat} action, the Tiger Lord Berserkers can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.kKnpTt39LwP8uUvf]{Rally}.

Supernatural Attacks (Unique Tactic).name: Supernatural Attacks (Unique Tactic)
Supernatural Attacks (Unique Tactic).description: Whenever a First World army scores a critical hit on another army, it increases that army’s @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-conditions.Item.eIQC69sOPbHAGxHC]{Weary} condition by 1 as their attacks cause some soldiers to become poisoned, fall asleep, shrink in size, or suffer other eerie side effects.

Tusker Training (Unique Tactic).name: Tusker Training (Unique Tactic)
Tusker Training (Unique Tactic).description: The Tusker Riders can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.ZJmURLLXPieDMMtj]{All-Out Assault}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.xwc8G2tA6ryhhOpK]{Covering Fire}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-kingmaker-tools.kingmaker-tools-army-actions.Item.ICVHilTUEvuUfeYZ]{Taunt} tactical actions.

Unpredictable Movement (Unique Tactic).name: Unpredictable Movement (Unique Tactic)
Unpredictable Movement (Unique Tactic).description: It’s difficult to do significant damage to the Drelev Irregulars with ranged attacks, as the mob moves about in a haphazard manner. All ranged  attacks against the Drelev Irregulars suffer a –2 circumstance penalty as a result.
